intro: Marsippospermum reichei, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Marsippospermum reichei is adapted to survive in extreme conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
